medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began 5 days prior to admission with right upper quadrant pain. The pain has not worsened or improved during this period. There was one episode of nausea/vomiting at the beginning, which resulted in slight improvement of the pain, but no vomiting has occurred since. Bowel habits are normal, with no instances of hematochezia, melena, or hematemesis.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Glaucoma, Hypertension, Hyperlipidemia, Paroxysmal Atrial Fibrillation, Osteopenia, Breast Cancer, Moderate Mitral Regurgitation, Keratoses of the face, Herpes Zoster, Psoriasis, Migraine, Varicose veins, Right leg fracture.
medical_history.family_history: Father died, mother died of dementia, brother with pancreatic cancer and hypertension.
